hanzi-su-wiki:
純

Значения

Чистота, искренность; чистый

Мнемоника

Большие усилия 屯 нужны для получения чистой шелковой нити 糸.

Варианты

纯
purpleculture_pinyin:
chún
pure; simple; unmixed; genuine
чистый; просто; несмешанный; подлинный
rtega_mnemonic:
純純RS
纯纯		pure, clean, simple, honest
  • a line 糸 of sprouts 屯 in the fields: pure and simple things
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 纯)
Synonym: 清
Antonyms: 雜 混
Pictophonetic: 屯 indicates the sound; 糹 (silk) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
純粹 [ chún cuì ]: pure; unadulterated; purely; completely
純潔 [ chún jié ]: pure; clean and honest; to purify
純淨 [ chún jìng ]: pure; clean; unmixed
純屬 [ chún shǔ ]: to be purely; pure and simple; sheer; outright
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 屯 [ tún ] village, hamlet; camp; station
heisig_chinese_memo: Earthworm Jim's prized possession is an unadulterated genuine copy of the #1 issue of Spiderman.
heisig_constituent: genuine, thread, spiderman, earthworm, drop, shovel, fishhook
koohiiStory1: For remembering the primitive earthworm: Drops of rain were falling so I took my shovel to dig up some earthworms to put them on my fishook..... My story: To have a genuine fishing line you don't just pick up a stick but you also attach some thread onto it and at the end an earthworm must be hung.
koohiiStory2: You need to attach a genuine earthworm to the thread. With plastic bait you won´t catch anything.
jp_example_words:
清純(せいじゅん): purity, innocence
純情(じゅんじょう): pure heart, naivete, self-sacrificing devotion
純粋(じゅんすい): pure, true, genuine, unmixed
単純(たんじゅん): simplicity
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Make your barracks out of thread so it will be pure. If you build it out of clay or bricks or wood, it will inevitably have some dirt in it. Build it out of thread to keep it pure of... well, impurities.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine a barracks pure white, like pure snow, made of pure thread.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This pure thread barracks can only be used in June (じゅん), unfortunately. Any other time of year there will be snow and rain and mud and that will get tracked into the pure barracks and ruin them. But June is the cleanest, most pure month, so you can use it then.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Okay, so maybe building a pure barracks that you can only use in June was a bad idea, but it's there now and I don't want you getting it dirty, so just use it when I say so, okay?
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 醇 (もっぱら、ジュン беспримесный) — тоже беспримесность на ジュン, но более редкий.

Ru_Radicals: 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 屯 (военный лагерь), 糸 (нить)
Ru_trainchinese: chún: (прил) чистый, без примеси; умелый
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the thread (糸) in the barracks (屯) is pure
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Earthworm Jim likes the original unadulterated version of the Spiderman comics. The new versions are not as cool.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: In the early inscriptions " pure " was used as " tun " instead of "糸", and in the later period from "糸" from " tun ", the structure is the same as Xiaozhuan, the original meaning is silk. Bronze writing is used as a person's name and its meaning is unknown. See " tun ". "Shuwen": "Pure, silk. From Shitotun sound. "The Analects" said: "Today is pure and frugal." "The Analects of Confucius-Zihan": "Zi said: "Ma Mian, rituals are also pure. Today is also pure , Frugal, I follow the crowd."" He Yan set an explanation: "Pure, silk also."

" Pure " can mean pure and pure. "Poetry·Song of Zhou·Vision of Heaven": "The virtue of the king of literature is pure." Zhu Xi's collection: "Pure, not mixed."

" Pure " also means beauty and goodness. "Book of Rites‧ Special Sacrifice in the Suburbs": "Mao, blood, tell the things of the quiet and the whole. Those who tell the things of the quiet and the whole, the noble pure way." Zheng Xuan's note: "Pure means that both Chinese and foreign are good."

" Pure " also means big. "Han Shu-Li Yue Zhi": "Only admiring pure virtue." Yan Shigu's note: "Pure, great."

" Pure " also means all, all, all. "Mo Zi‧ Jie Yong Shang": "If you are pure for three years and have characters, you can live two or three years." Sun Yirang Jian: ""Zhou Li‧ Jade People" Note: "Pure still is also.""
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: In the early inscriptions " pure " was used as " tun " instead of "糸", and in the later period from "糸" from " tun ", it has the same configuration as Xiaozhuan, and its original meaning is silk.
humanum_full_description:
早期金文「純」作「屯」，不從「糸」，後期從「糸」從「屯」，與小篆構形相同，本義為絲。金文用作人名，意義不詳。參見「屯」。《說文》：「純，絲也。从糸屯聲。《論語》曰：『今也純，儉。』」《論語‧子罕》：「子曰：『麻冕，禮也。今也純，儉，吾從眾。』」何晏集解：「純，絲也。」

　　「純」可表示純粹、精純。《詩‧周頌‧維天之命》：「文王之德之純。」朱熹集傳：「純，不雜也。」

　　「純」還表示美、善。《禮記‧郊特牲》：「毛、血，告幽全之物也。告幽全之物者，貴純之道也。」鄭玄注：「純，謂中外皆善。」

　　「純」也表示大。《漢書‧禮樂志》：「惟慕純德。」顏師古注：「純，大也。」

　　「純」亦表示皆、全、都。《墨子‧節用上》：「若純三年而字子，生可以二三年矣。」孫詒讓間詁：「《周禮‧玉人》註：『純猶皆也。』」
humanum_short_description: 早期金文「純」作「屯」，不從「糸」，後期從「糸」從「屯」，與小篆構形相同，本義為絲。

清純(せいじゅん): purity, innocence

早期金文「 純 」作「 屯 」，不從「 糸 」，後期從「 糸 」從「 屯 」，與小篆構形相同，本義為絲。金文用作人名，意義不詳。參見「 屯 」。《說文》：「純，絲也。从糸屯聲。《論語》曰：『今也純，儉。』」《論語‧子罕》：「子曰：『麻冕，禮也。今也純，儉，吾從眾。』」何晏集解：「純，絲也。」 「 純 」可表示純粹、精純。《詩‧周頌‧維天之命》：「文王之德之純。」朱熹集傳：「純，不雜也。」 「 純 」還表示美、善。《禮記‧郊特牲》：「毛、血，告幽全之物也。告幽全之物者，貴純之道也。」鄭玄注：「純，謂中外皆善。」 「 純 」也表示大。《漢書‧禮樂志》：「惟慕純德。」顏師古注：「純，大也。」 「 純 」亦表示皆、全、都。《墨子‧節用上》：「若純三年而字子，生可以二三年矣。」孫詒讓間詁：「《周禮‧玉人》註：『純猶皆也。』」
Elaboration: In the early inscriptions " pure" was used as " tun" instead of " 糸", and in the later period from " 糸" from " tun", the structure is the same as Xiaozhuan, the original meaning is silk. Bronze writing is used as a person's name and its meaning is unknown. See " tun". "Shuwen": "Pure, silk. From Shitotun sound. "The Analects" said: "Today is pure and frugal." "The Analects of Confucius-Zihan": "Zi said: "Ma Mian, rituals are also pure. Today is also pure , Frugal, I follow the crowd."" He Yan set an explanation: "Pure, silk also." " Pure" can mean pure and pure. "Poetry·Song of Zhou·Vision of Heaven": "The virtue of the king of literature is pure." Zhu Xi's collection: "Pure, not mixed." " Pure" also means beauty and goodness. "Book of Rites‧ Special Sacrifice in the Suburbs": "Mao, blood, tell the things of the quiet and the whole. Those who tell the things of the quiet and the whole, the noble pure way." Zheng Xuan's note: "Pure means that both Chinese and foreign are good." " Pure" also means big. "Han Shu-Li Yue Zhi": "Only admiring pure virtue." Yan Shigu's note: "Pure, great." " Pure" also means all, all, all. "Mo Zi‧ Jie Yong Shang": "If you are pure for three years and have characters, you can live two or three years." Sun Yirang Jian: ""Zhou Li‧ Jade People" Note: "Pure still is also.""

純字的基本解释

純
chún
见“纯”。

純字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chún］
［《廣韻》常倫切，平諄，禪。］
“纯1”的繁体字。
(1)丝。
(2)纯粹；精纯。
(3)美；善。
(4)大。
(5)淳厚；纯笃。
(6)皆；全；都。
(7)古代博戏之一种。谓扑钱时，头钱全是背面。
[②]［zhǔn］
［《廣韻》之尹切，上準，章。］
“纯2”的繁体字。
(1)镶边；边缘。
(2)古代布帛的宽度。
[③]［tún］
［《集韻》徒渾切，平魂，定。］
“纯3”的繁体字。
(1)缠束；包裹。参见“純3束”。
(2)计量单位。布帛一段为一纯。
[④]［quán］
［《集韻》從緣切，平，從。］
“纯4”的繁体字。
全；一双。
[⑤]［zhūn］
［《集韻》朱倫切，平諄，章。］
“纯5”的繁体字。
见“純5純”。
[⑥]［zī］
［《集韻》莊持切，平之，莊。］
“纯6”的繁体字。通“緇1”。
黑色丝织物。

純字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　純； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页917第06
〔古文〕?㝄【廣韻】常倫切【集韻】殊倫切，?音淳。【說文】絲也。【論語】今也純儉，吾從衆。【何晏註】純，絲也。絲易成，故從儉。【前漢·王褒傳】難與道純緜之麗密。　又【易·乾卦】純粹，精也。【疏】純粹，不雜。　又【書·酒誥】嗣爾股肱純。【傳】繼汝股肱之敎，爲純一之行。　又【詩·大雅】純嘏爾常矣。【箋】純，大也。　又【詩·周頌】文王之德之純。【箋】純，亦不已也。　又【周禮·冬官考工記】諸侯純九，大夫純五。【註】純，猶皆也。　又【禮·郊特牲】貴純之道也。【註】純，謂中外皆善。　又【左傳·隱元年】潁考叔，純孝也。【註】純，猶篤也。　又【前漢·地理志】織作冰紈綺繡純麗之物。【註】純，精好也。　又【淮南子·地形訓】里閒九純，純丈五尺。【註】純，量名。　又【集韻】主尹切【韻會】之尹切，?音準。【書·顧命】篾席黼純。【註】白黑雜繒緣之。【儀禮·士冠禮】服纁裳純衣。【註】純衣，緣衣也。又【旣夕】緇純。【註】飾衣曰純。【禮·曲禮】冠衣不純素。【註】純，緣也。　又【集

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chún］
["Guangyun" Chang Lunqie, flat and simple, Zen. ]
"纯1" in traditional characters.
(1) Silk.
(2) Pure; pure.
(3) Beauty; goodness.
(4) Big.
(5) Honest; pure and honest.
(6) All; all; all.
(7) A kind of ancient gambling. When it comes to punting money, the first money is all on the back.
[②]［zhǔn］
[Yin cut in "Guang Yun", first quasi, chapter. ]
"纯2" in traditional characters.
(1) Edge; edge.
(2) The width of ancient cloth.
[③]［tún］
["Jiyun" is full of excitement, calm soul, and set. ]
"纯3" in traditional characters.
(1) Twisted bundle; wrapped. See "Pure 3 beams".
(2) Unit of measurement. One piece of cloth and silk is pure.
[④]［quán］
["Ji Yun" cut from the margin, level , from. ]
"纯4" in traditional characters.
Full; a pair.
[⑤]［zhūn］
["Jiyun" Zhu Lunqie, flat and simple, chapter. ]

See "Pure 5 Pure".
[⑥] [zī]
["Ji Yun" Zhuang Zhiqie, Pingzhi, Zhuang. ]

Black silk fabric.

[Not concentrated] [Shizi Department] 　chun; Kangxi strokes: 10; page number: page 917 06
〔古文〕? 㝄 [Guang Yun] Chang Lunqi [Ji Yun] is unique and cut,? Yin Chun. [Said Wen] Silk also. [The Analects] Today is also pure and frugal, I follow the crowd. [He Yan's Note] Pure, silk also. Silk is easy to become, so thrifty. 【Previous Han·Wang Baozhuan】Is it so pure and beautiful?　[Yi·Qian Gua] is pure and refined. 【Sparse】Pure, not complicated.　[Book·Liquor] Heir stock and brachial pure. 【Biography】Following the ruling of the humerus, it is a journey of pure one.　[Poetry·Daya] Pure and elegant. [Jan] Pure, great.　[Poetry·Zhou Song] The pure virtue of the King of Literature. [Jan] Pure and endless.　[Zhou Li·Dongguan Kao Gong Ji] The princes are pure nine, and the doctor is pure five. [Note] Pure, it's still all.　[Li·jiao Special Sacrifice] Gui Chun Zhi. [Note] Pure means that both Chinese and foreign are good.　[Zuo Zhuan·Yin First Year] Uncle Ying Kao, pure filial piety. [Note] Pure, still true.　[Pre-Han Geography] Weaving and making ice 纨 beautiful and pure and beautiful things. [Note] Pure, refined.　[Huainanzi·Training of Terrain] Lixian Jiuchun, pure zhang five feet. [Note] Pure, quantitative name.　 [Ji Yun] Yin Che of Lord Yin Che [Yun Hui],? The pronunciation is accurate. [Book·Gu Ming] Zhu Xi Shunchun. [Note] The white and black mixed fate. [Ritual Ceremony·Shiguan Ceremony] Clothes are pure clothes. 【Note】Pure clothing, edge clothing also. Also 【旣夕】缁纯. [Note] Adorned clothes are said to be pure. 【Rite·Cute】The crown and dress are not vegan. [Note] Pure, fate.　又【集

Name meaning

chún
вм. 纯
Radicals: 糸, 屯  (thread, barracks)
Meaning Mnemonic
Make your barracks out of thread so it will be pure. If you build it out of clay or bricks or wood, it will inevitably have some dirt in it. Build it out of thread to keep it pure of... well, impurities.
Imagine a barracks pure white, like pure snow, made of pure thread.
Reading Mnemonic
This pure thread barracks can only be used in June (じゅん), unfortunately. Any other time of year there will be snow and rain and mud and that will get tracked into the pure barracks and ruin them. But June is the cleanest, most pure month, so you can use it then.
Okay, so maybe building a pure barracks that you can only use in June was a bad idea, but it's there now and I don't want you getting it dirty, so just use it when I say so, okay?
